tools.name: read_file
tools.description: Read the complete contents of a file from the file system. Handles various text encodings and provides detailed error messages if the file cannot be read. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path to the file to read

tools.name: read_text_file
tools.description: Read text content from a file, ensuring it is valid UTF-8 text. Returns an error if the file contains non-text content. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path to the text file to read

tools.name: read_media_file
tools.description: Read media files (images, audio, video, PDFs) and return them as base64-encoded content with appropriate MIME types. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path to the media file to read

tools.name: read_multiple_files
tools.description: Read the contents of multiple files simultaneously. This is more efficient than reading files one by one when you need to analyze or compare multiple files. Each file's content is returned with its path as a reference. Failed reads for individual files won't stop the entire operation. Only works within allowed directories.

paths.description: Array of file paths to read

tools.name: write_file
tools.description: Create a new file or completely overwrite an existing file with new content. Use with caution as it will overwrite existing files without warning. Creates parent directories if they don't exist. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path where the file should be written

content.description: The content to write to the file

tools.name: edit_file
tools.description: Make line-based edits to a text file. Each edit replaces exact line sequences with new content. Returns a git-style diff showing the changes made. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path to the file to edit

oldText.description: Text to search for â€” must match exactly

edits.description: Array of edit operations to apply

dryRun.description: Preview changes using git-style diff format

tools.name: create_directory
tools.description: Create a new directory or ensure a directory exists. Can create multiple nested directories in one operation. If the directory already exists, this operation will succeed silently. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path of the directory to create

tools.name: list_directory
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path. Results clearly distinguish between files and directories with [FILE] and [DIR] prefixes. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path of the directory to list

tools.name: list_directory_with_sizes
tools.description: Get a detailed listing of all files and directories in a specified path, including file sizes and last modified times. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path of the directory to list

tools.name: directory_tree
tools.description: Get a recursive tree view of files and directories as a JSON structure. Each entry includes 'name', 'type' (file/directory), and 'children' for directories. Files also include a 'size' field with the file size in bytes. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The root path to create the tree from

tools.name: move_file
tools.description: Move or rename files and directories. Can move files between directories and rename them in a single operation. If the destination exists, the operation will fail. Works across different directories. Both source and destination must be within allowed directories.

source.description: The current path of the file or directory

destination.description: The new path for the file or directory

tools.name: search_files
tools.description: Recursively search for files and directories matching a pattern. Searches through all subdirectories from the starting path. The search is case-insensitive and matches partial names. Returns full paths to all matching items. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The starting path for the search

pattern.description: The search pattern to match against file and directory names

excludePatterns.description: Patterns to exclude from search results

tools.name: get_file_info
tools.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a file or directory. Returns comprehensive information including size, creation time, last modified time, permissions, and type. Only works within allowed directories.

path.description: The path to the file or directory

tools.name: list_allowed_directories
tools.description: Returns the list of directories that this server is allowed to access. Use this to understand which directories are available before trying to access files.
